newsitem.title: USA: New Yorkers chasing $70 million lottery jackpot.
newsitem.headline: New Yorkers chasing $70 million lottery jackpot.

text.p: New Yorkers from all walks of life Friday were lining up to buy tickets for this weekend's $70 million lottery, the third largest in the state's history.
The drawing of the winning numbers will take place Saturday at 11:21 p.m.

"If I won, I'd probably pay off all my debt, all my friends' debt and all my family's debt," said Karen Iocca, an administrative assistant from New Jersey, who bought a handful of Lotto tickets Friday.

Queens computer consultant Shimon Lichtman, who says he has figured out a "system" for picking numbers that involves going diagonally down the ticket columns, took a similarly pragmatic view when asked what he would do if he hit it big.

Bobby Patel, manager of a cramped newsstand in a Manhattan office building, said he had sold about 15,000 Lotto tickets Friday. "We had one winner a year and a half ago," he said. "He came and shook my hand."

The odds of winning Saturday's drawing are 12.9 million to one, according to Ric Grenell, a spokesman for New York State Lottery. This lottery is the largest in North America, pulling in $4 billion in lottery game sales last year.

There are currently 250,000 compulsive gamblers in the state of New York, Laura Letson, a spokeswoman for the New York Council on Problem Gambling, said, placing New York behind only Louisiana in the prevalence of "problem" gambling.

"The majority of people lose, many of whom lose big," Letson said. For most people, playing the lottery is a way to dream, but for some it can be a nightmare of debt, crime and ruined relationships, she added.
The biggest winner ever in the state's lottery history was Anthony Bueti, a Brooklyn resident who was the sole winner of a January 1990 jackpot of $35 million.

The largest lottery drawing was in January 1991 with a $90 jackpot; nine people split the winnings. In October 1994 a pot of $72.5 million was divvied up among four players. With both jackpots, five was one of the six numbers drawn, Grenell said.
